attributes.action: Save Bolsover Community Hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bolsover community hospital is under threat from the public services cuts imposed by the current government. We need your help in saving our hospital which provides fantastic services and relieves the pressure on the larger hospitals which are already under strain.
attributes.additional_details: Bolsover community hospital is under threat of closure from the severe cuts facing all public services. The hospital offers physiotherapy treatment and advice, intermediate care services aiming to prevent people from being admitted to hospital which is essential for all major hospitals in the current financial climate and mental health services for the elderly which are essential in any community. Bolsover has lost a lot over the years, let's not add our hospital to the ever growing list.

attributes.action: Department of Transport to look into the service run by Abellio Greater Anglia.
attributes.background: Today train services were severely disrupted by overhead power cable failures. Even though Network Rail maintain these, the rolling stock is beyond fit for purpose with passengers sweltering in carriages.

attributes.action: Protect our freedom to collect wild food from common land for personal use.
attributes.background: In light of the Forestry commission's unscientific & undemocratic decision to ban fungi picking in the New Forest, against the weight of evidence, we the undersigned demand the government enact legal protections for our rights to forage for personal use as per those detailed in the theft act 1968.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.conservationevidence.com/individual-study/230
25 year longitudinal study, showing mushroom picking has no effect on the fungal ecosystem.

Ref: 'New Forest fungi picking ban "unscientific" say fungi experts'

http://www.foragers-association.org.uk/index.php/press/new-forest-fungi-picking-ban-press-release

swedish model of "everyman's right"

http://www.sverigeturism.se/smorgasbord/smorgasbord/natrecspo/nature/every.html

Theft act: http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1968/60/contents

attributes.action: Give psv holders class 2 entitlement.
attributes.background: A PSV holder is a person who holds a licence to drive a bus, with this they can drive any type of bus from a minibus & double decker, right up to a bendy bus. They carry very precious cargo (the general public). But yet holders of these licences can't drive a class 2 lorry. It doesn't make sense.
attributes.additional_details:
For example,
Bus length - 12 metres,
Class 2 lorry - 7.9 metres

Bus weight - 14 ton
Class 2 lorry weight - 7.5 ton

Bus contents - passengers
Class 2 content - packages and goods

If for example you drive a bendy bus, you need similar skills to a class 1 lorry driver in relation to length and reversing. 

My argument is that psv drivers are more highly trained and skilled than a class 2 driver because of the contents and vehicle sizes, and they should automatically have class 2 entitlement.

attributes.action: Call on Government to commission an independent technical review of HS2
attributes.background:
HS2 cannot meet its stated objective of delivering “..hugely enhanced capacity and connectivity between our major conurbations”. 

We call on HM Government to commission an independent technical review of every aspect of the HS2 scheme to determine how and why this failure has happened.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 is an ill-conceived and fundamentally flawed design for a high speed rail line linking London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Originally costed at £30 billion, it is now estimated to cost £56 billion or more. The project is highly controversial because of HS2 Ltd’s failure to evaluate cheaper & better alternatives, its exorbitant cost, insufficient new capacity, poor connectivity, demolition of 500+ homes, serious damage to the Chilterns AONB & Ancient Woodlands and failure to reduce CO2

attributes.action: Equally free GCSE and A Level Exams for Home Educated Children..
attributes.background:
Thousands of UK citizens home educate!  School failed some of these families,  others simply home educate out of personal preference. 

Is it right to disadvantage children educated at zero expense to tax payers? Why then the fees for home educated children to sit GCSEs and A levels?
attributes.additional_details:
For every year I teach my own children, the tax payers save between £3000 and £6000 This is the case for every home educated child. No funding is provided in anyway. I am a single parent and we are a low income family because of our choice, we accept that this will be the case until I have finished teaching the children. 

 However, we do ask  the same free provision of GCSE and A Level examinations  for home educated children,  who should have equal opportunities in this area at the very least.

attributes.action: Reform the system of obtaining Permanent Residence Certification/Card (PR)
attributes.background: The current system of PR discriminates against many groups of EU/EEA residents and their non-EEA spouses/civil partners. This reform will facilitate EU/EEA nationals to obtain Permanent Resident Certification/Card (PR), currently mandatory to become UK citizens (for those who wish to do so).
attributes.additional_details:
-British spouses/civil partners to be considered as sponsors for their EU/EEA spouses/civil partners in PR applications 
-Scrap Comprehensive Sickness Insurance as PR requirement for EU/EEA students, homemakers, carers, retired, and disabled people or applicants self-sufficient through other income, including their non-EEA spouses/civil partners
-EU/EEA nationals, their spouses/civil partners, their children, who have exercised treaty rights for less than 5 years, to complete their journey to PR 
-Parents/carers of British citizens to obtain PR automatically 
-Spouses/civil partners of UK service men/women to acquire PR without proof of residency 
-PR to be protected under UK law 
-Type of residency evidence, currently accepted for PR/ILR, to be accepted for UK citizenship.

attributes.action: Stop all refugees to the UK.
attributes.background: This only encourages more to come, we already have enough issues with looking after our own people.  Help should be focused in the closest safe country.

attributes.action: Make it a law for vets to scan pets each time they visit.
attributes.background: I want to make it a law that all pets must be scanned when they visit the vet. This will majorly decrease the chances of lost or stolen pets slipping the net and not finding their way home. By scanning a pet each time, these pet's owners can be traced meaning many broken families can be reunited.

attributes.action: Give survivors of domestic abuse anonymous registration on Electoral Register.
attributes.background:
For survivors of domestic abuse who have been to refuge, continued anonymity can be a matter of life and death. 

The Government must change the guidance so that people who are leaving refuge are automatically offered anonymous inclusion on the Electoral Register.
attributes.additional_details:
Current guidance asks for court documents or a letter of attestation which can only be provided by:
•	a police officer of or above the rank of superintendant
•	the Director General of the Security Service (MI5) or the Serious Organised Crime Agency
•	a director of adult social services or children’s services in England 
These people are difficult for any member of the public to contact, meaning many survivors do not register at all.

Further info:
http://huff.to/1J3BGW7
http://bit.ly/1Rq6Fuh

attributes.action: Declare the 23 June EU referendum null as many UK expatriates were unrepresented
attributes.background: There are some 3 million expatriate UK citizens, equivalent to around one-tenth of the total votes cast in the referendum. Many have been denied a vote as they have been living abroad for 15 years or more. Had their votes been recognised, they could have tipped the balance in favour of Remain.
attributes.additional_details: Of an estimated 3 million expatriate UK citizens, the 1.2 million living in EU countries are those most immediately affected by Brexit, yet many of their voices have not been heard. The fact that they have not been UK-resident for 15 years should not exclude them from voting in an issue of great importance with a direct impact upon their lives. Their numbers would be sufficient to change the result in favour of Remain. The referendum should be declared null, or repeated with full representation.

attributes.action: Save Banbury Horton General Hospital From Extensive and Dangerous Cuts
attributes.background:
Oxford University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust (OUHFT) is consulting on the way services are provided at the Horton General Hospital in Banbury
Their plans could take away A&E, consultant-led maternity, Special Care Baby Unit (SCBU), 24 hour / 7 day a week children's ward and intensive care.
attributes.additional_details: The John Radcliffe Hospital is yet again expected to be the main bolster for all emergency services. That's fine if you live near by, however what happens when you live 40 minutes to an hour away from the hospital and your in need of assistance, due to either injury, sudden illness or because your in labour. The answer, make your way to the John Radcliffe. This is unacceptable. Please support our campaign. For further information visit the following website. http://www.keepthehortongeneral.org

attributes.action: Stop vaccination with the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in our schools.
attributes.background: There is parental concern about the use of the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in schools. There may be a risk of inhalation of the GM viral particles to those not consenting and evidence shows that recently vaccinated children may transmit the vaccine influenza strain to others in their community.
attributes.additional_details: If it is true that non consenting children are exposed to the GM viral particles or to the vaccine strains of influenza in school, the Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Programme would appear to directly contradict the Secretary of State’s declaration in The Health Protection (Vaccination) Regulations 2009. This states that 'there is no provision for imposing or enabling any restriction or requirement which has, or would have, a significant effect on a person’s rights'.

attributes.action: Legislate 4 weeks paid Parental Leave for the death of a Child.
attributes.background:
Did you know that if your Child dies your employer doesn't have to give you time off from work? You can have "up to 12 months leave for the birth of a child,but just 3 days to grieve your child"
My son Jack was just 23 months old when he tragically died and I discovered this anomaly in law.
attributes.additional_details: In August 2010, my son Jack died just 2 weeks away from his 2nd birthday. I have been tirelessly trying to make a change in his memory.Grief effects us all differently, there is no wrong or right way to grieve but it should be our way in how we choose to grieve.While many good employers offer compassionate leave, there is no statutory right to leave and this needs to change.In 2014 I worked with ACAS to create guidance but still believe bereavement leave needs to be legislated.Will you Sign?

attributes.action: implement a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing (fracking) for 20 years
attributes.background: fracking is still in the early stages of development compared with other mining methods but seems to already be implicated in various environmental problems, a Law that would ban all hydraulic fracturing for a minimum of 20 years will give time to show the long term implications for the environment

attributes.action: Urgent research for AT/RT Tumours must be done in the UK.
attributes.background: Rhiley Kim Bennett was diagnosed with an AT/RT Tumour on her brain & spine aged just 2 years old on 12th June 2014. We lost our little girl on 23rd April 2015 aged 3. With the majority of under 3's being diagnosed, the chance of survival remains low at just 15% or less.
attributes.additional_details:
* Atypical Teratoid Rhabdoid Tumour known as AT/RT for short. 
* Although usually a brain tumour, it can occur anywhere in the CNS.
* It is the most common solid tumour in childhood cancer. 
* Effects all of the basic bodily functions. 
* AT/RT grows rapidly & patients have a fairly short history of progressive symptoms, measured in days to weeks. 
* It has been challenging to define optimal therapy & advance treatment. 
* The UK currently has no standard protocol itself to follow nor a cure.

attributes.action: Implement an Opt-Out Organ Donation System (as in Wales): LET'S SAVE LIVES
attributes.background: Marnie Brace was born with Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy. At 14 weeks old she went into heart failure & was placed on the heart transplant list. At that time she was the UK's youngest patient awaiting such surgery. Sadly, Marnie is just one of 6,599 people currently awaiting a transplant in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Previously, the government responded that opt-out systems 'might have the potential to deliver benefits' yet it had 'no plans’ to introduce it. Data from the Welsh Government confirms the benefit of the Opt-Out System implemented in 2015:
- 53% of organs donated via deemed consent (32/60 organs)
- Rise: 50% liver transplants; 19% kidney transplants; 63% cardiothoracic transplants
- 38% drop in patients awaiting transplant between 2010/11 & 2015/16
Opt-Out Systems clearly SAVE lives. Please sign!
attributes.creator_name: Sarah Barton (on behalf of Nick & Amy Brace)

attributes.action: Petition the MOD to collect the statistics for Suicide rates amongst UK Veterens
attributes.background: Reports have indicated that 22 US Armed Forces Veterans commit suicide every day and this has been linked to undiagnosed PTSD from the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. Currently the MOD do not collect these statistics for UK veterans. Our Vets could be suffering in silence, this needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence here. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/324458/PUBLIC_1403616620.pdf

attributes.action: Muslim school children to be allowed Eid as holiday
attributes.background: Muslim students in the UK don't get a holiday on the two Eid days every year - Eid ul Fitar and Eid ul Adha. Being the only two (or the biggest two) religious celebrations for the Muslims the students should get official holidays on these two occasions.
attributes.additional_details: Islam is the second largest religion with results from the United Kingdom Census 2011. The number of people practicing the religion of Islam in the United Kingdom exceeds 3 million. Some neighborhood towns have more than 50% Muslim population.

attributes.action: To save the 16 remaining hospital beds at Okehampton Hospital
attributes.background: The Clinical Commission Group are proposing to remove the 16 remaining hospital beds at Okehampton Hospital. Residents of Okehampton and the surrounding area, urge the retention of our local hospital beds. Okehampton is the hub of a huge rural area with a population of 20,000 people. .
attributes.additional_details:
Okehampton is geographically isolated from East Devon hospitals where beds are retained for non-acute care.
 
The frail and elderly need local pre and post op beds for rehabilitation and nursing care 24/7 and a proper care package before they go home. With poor public transport some friends and families already travel many miles to get to Okehampton.

attributes.action: Allow serving members in armed forces & veterans free travel on public transport
attributes.background: in the uk disabled people unemployed and the old can jump on buses for free and in some areas can use rail networks on a discount, at current the armed forces have to pay for a rail card, yet inthe US , canada and some parts of the EU there veterans and serving soldiers can travel for free.
attributes.additional_details:
the UK has loads of veterans aged 22- 75 with the most being in the    22 - 30  aged group for the first time since WW2 due to commitments in afghan and iraq in the last decade,
TFL has awarded a 3 year Oyster card for veterans who have been injured in service, this should not be a perk but a recconition to the service given and extended to all train and bus companies in the UK
 at any time with either there military id or veterans badge.

attributes.action: Get an elctronic sign on York A64 to warn drivers of queues & stationary traffic
attributes.background: I have set up a group on facebook supporting getting an illuminated sign put up to warn motorists of stationary and queing traffic with over 2k members in 24 hrs. A sign well in advance of where the queuing traffic usually is will allow motorists to prepare & take an alternative routes.

attributes.action: Change NHS sight tests to meet the needs of people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: There are huge levels of sight problems amongst people with learning disabilities but they suffer unequal access to eye care. This is leaving many people with poor vision or even tragically losing their sight.
attributes.additional_details: The charity SeeAbility is calling for national pathways of eye care for people with learning disabilities, including for children in special schools, and for all working age adults with learning disabilities to be eligible for NHS funded sight tests. People are likely to need additional time or appointments to complete a sight test. This requires the Department of Health and NHS England to change the statutory and funding framework for NHS sight tests, to deliver an equal right to sight.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of foie gras in the UK
attributes.background: Foie gras is produced by the cruel and sustained force-feeding of ducks and geese until their livers become enlarged by up to ten times the natural size. This frequently scars the oesophagus and causes their organs to rupture. Many birds literally burst or choke to death on their own vomit.
attributes.additional_details:
Production of foie gras is so cruel it would be illegal in the UK under several animal welfare laws, but it can be legally imported and sold despite this contributing directly to the exact cruelty we have laws to prevent? 

Force feeding begins when the birds are 12 weeks old, happens 3 times a day using a pipe forced down the throat, and lasts for 12-15 days. The birds are kept in small, individual cages. They can't stand, walk, preen or stretch their wings. 

And all of this for a 'delicacy'.

attributes.action: Formally consult resident EU citizens on whether the UK should leave the EU .
attributes.background: The vast majority of the 3 million EU citizens resident in Britain had no vote in the referendum on Britain’s membership of the EU and if they had been consulted the result could have been different.
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens are those British residents who are most severely affected by the result of the EU referendum but had no say in it. They have a right to vote and stand in local elections and elections to the European Parliament, rights that would be lost if the UK leaves the EU. They are now in a state of uncertainty and fear. This seems a travesty of natural justice. They need to be consulted, for instance by a referendum specific to them.

attributes.action: Merge class 2 and and pcv licences into one
attributes.background:
Bus drivers carry the most precious cargo in the world, but cant drive a 32 tonne lorry full of groceries 
Give category D license holders their class 2 lgv license

attributes.action: Regulation of changeover fees charged by caravan site owners
attributes.background: Make it illegal for static caravan site owners to charge a fee in respect of change of ownership of a caravan where the sale is a private sale and the caravan site has had no involvement in the sale. Also to cap the fees charged where the site owner has sold a caravan on behalf of an owner

attributes.action: Approved Mental Health Professionals are underpaid and under resourced.
attributes.background: There has been a huge increase in the need for AMHP services and there are scant resources.
attributes.additional_details: Staff are undervalued, underpaid and isolated. Support from agencies is reduced. Service users are suffering. Beds in MH units are scarce and miles away. There is significant risk of harm to AMHPs and service users. There is no recognition of the importance of the AMHP role in maintaining safety within the community and addressing acute mental illness. Resources are being withdrawn. AMHPs need re evaluation in salary and support

attributes.action: Fund Research into Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is a debilitating and often life threatening conditions, there is very little research and we are a long way off a cure, we need research.

attributes.action: To change the Animal Welfare Act 2006
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to change the Animal Welfare Act 2006, making it a LIFE ban on any person found to be cruel to an animal.
At present it is only for some, most people only get 10 yrs. 
We feel that if a person abuses an animal once they WILL do it again at their first convenience!

attributes.action: We want RM stonehouse to be kept open it's the  spiritual home and HQ for RM
attributes.background: The government  recently announced that Stonehouse was being put up for sale. Stonehouse is the spiritual embodiment of the Royal Marines  and three commando Brigade is the Royal marines home  and shouldn't be sold for housing it is a listed building that has a lots of heart and history.
attributes.additional_details:
The earliest parts of Stonehouse Barracks date from 1756 The buildings immediately became the headquarters of the Plymouth Division of the Royal Marines. Although the divisional structure of the Royal Marines was dismantled during the Second World War, the barracks remain in use as headquarters of 3 Commando Brigade. 
It is also home to the globe theatre a beautiful music hall. 
As a whole, Stonehouse is described as "the oldest and most important group of barracks in England not forming part of a fortification, a very rare example of C18 planning, and a complex of great historic value

attributes.action: Ask Andrea Leadsom to agree to a TOTAL ban on ivory sales including before 1947
attributes.background:
Demand for ivory has seen almost 150,000 elephants lost to poaching in under a decade.
On 21/9/16 Andrea Leadsom announced plans for a ban on sales of modern day ivory, but allowing trade before 1947.
CITES CoP17 taking place in Johannesburg, South Africa from 24 September to 5 October 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
DEFRA will consult on plans for the ban next year. 
Environment Secretary Andrea Leadsom said:
The UK has a strong record as a global leader in the fight against the illegal wildlife trade and I’m determined to do all we can to bring an end to poaching and ivory trafficking.
"To do all that DEFRA can" would be to have a TOTAL ban on ivory sales before and after 1947.
Therefore I call on Andrea Leadsom to plan for a TOTAL ban on all ivory trade in and out of the UK.

attributes.action: Reinstate tax credits for those who have claims stopped by concentrix.
attributes.background: As many are aware, concentrix have cancelled many people's claims for tax credits forcing many people to live under there means, for weeks and sometimes even months. This is disgusting & needs to be fixed ASAP. We need money to survive.

attributes.action: To allow every serviceman and woman to have a dignified funeral
attributes.background: Veterans Bereavement Support Services call upon the Government to ensure that veterans who pass away without anyone to deal with their affairs have something more than a pauper’s funeral to recognise their passing. The Government needs to pay for a basic attendance funeral

attributes.action: Put the British army on our side of the Euro tunnel.
attributes.background: On the news today I saw a report by the BBC saying that there are people calling for the french army on the other side of the Euro tunnel. During the E.U referendum the french had threatened Britain with military action and now we voted out its convenient that only now they consider it.
attributes.additional_details: I think this is dangerous and suspect at best. And with a strong invasion buy Islamic extremist taking place in french politic's is safe to say that we do not know the full extent of the possible danger. There for until we know where we stand after Article 50 has been used i feel it is in the best interest or the British people to have security messures this side of the euro tunnel to protect us from a very probable Trojan horse attack. this offers safety and the ability to fill the tunnel if so

attributes.action: Amend Exclusionary Rape Law that excludes woman from committing rape
attributes.background: The rape definition uses gendered language ‘he’ and excluding female perpetrators from the legal definition.This excludes victims of female perpetrators by excluding them from official statistics, research, and denies them equal justice and support since sexual assault carried a lesser sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1/crossheading/rape/section/1

This definition concerns penetration (penile emphasis) to the exclusion of envelopment (vaginal emphasis)

This breaks the Equality Act 2010, by indirect discrimination
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/equality-act-2010-guidance

Rape is “Forced to have sex against their will” yet a form of this is classed only as sexual assault, carrying a lesser sentence.

http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1

attributes.action: Explain why FCO 30/1048 was withheld from the British public for 30 years
attributes.background: In 1971, an FCO memorandum known as FCO 30/1048 was drafted. This document details how the UK would surrender sovereignty if it were to join the E.E.C/EU. However, this document was classified as Confidential, and not released into the public domain until 2002.
attributes.additional_details:
The surrender of sovereign powers, as a consequence of signing the Treaty of Rome, Maastricht, and Lisbon, is in breach of the British constitution, as detailed in the Bill of Rights 1688.

This Bill has never been repealed, and as such was and is still in force. The contents of FCO 30/1048, and the effect to UK sovereignty, were not made available to the British public during the 1975 referendum.

References:
Bill of Rights 1688
FCO 30/1048
Treaty of Rome
Maastricht Treaty
Lisbon Treaty

attributes.action: Make 8 weeks scans routine during pregnancy in addition to 12 & 20 weeks.
attributes.background: We experienced a missed miscarriage that wasn't picked up until our routine 12 weeks scan. Our baby had stopped developing 2 months previous at 5 weeks. Because the pregnancy had gone on so long I had to have surgical management which required a general anaesthetic and a overnight stay in hospital.
attributes.additional_details: Other developed countries offer routine scans at 8 weeks to pick up any concerns as early as possible. Why don't we have this in the UK? Recent studies show 45% of women who have had a miscarriage show signs of PTSD. When 20-25% of pregnancies end in miscarriage and up to 75% are in 1st trimester, earlier precautions should be essential. Because our pregnancy was so advanced I had to have a surgical miscarriage under general anaesthetic. The US and Australia offer 8 week scans and so should we.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 running through the Dearne Valley and destroying our community
attributes.background: On 7th July 2016 HS2 announced their intention to run the line through the Dearne Valley, destroying the new Shimmer estate and blighting hundreds of other homes in the area. In addition, this will involve the destruction of local wildlife habitats and a huge viaduct blighting open countryside.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/hs2-plan-and-profile-maps-conisbrough-to-ryhill

attributes.action: Save our Bass: do not water down the proposal to ban nets.
attributes.background: We are calling on George Eustice, the UK Fisheries Minister, to support the Commission's proposals and not to cave in to commercial pressure like last year, to the anger and dismay of anglers and other conservationists.
attributes.additional_details: Commercial netting has hammered the bass stock. It is now so dangerously low that it may not recover for years. Anglers and conservationists argue that it is time to get rid of the nets. The EU Commission agrees and has proposed banning nets from the bass fishery from next year. These nets also kill sea-birds, seals, porpoises and dolphins. Getting rid of the nets, but retaining recreational fishing and commercial hook & line, will mean a bright and vibrant future for a sustainable bass fishery.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland's emergency services to be VAT exempt just like others in the UK
attributes.background: The UK Government has refused to allow Scotland's newly formed Emergency services to be tax exempt which is the case for the rest of the UK's Emergency services. This is wrong and unjust a d needs to end immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Millions are wasted by Police Scotland being unable to claim back VAT as other Police and fire services do.
It's completely illogical and unjust that Scotland should be forced to pay VAT without being able to reclaim it.

attributes.action: To teach UK pupils how food choices impact the environment
attributes.background:
No other single activity has a bigger impact on the planet than the raising of livestock for meat, milk and eggs.

By adding to the school curriculum we can introduce positive environmental change by educating pupils of how their buying behaviour and food choices effect the world we live in.
attributes.additional_details: http://science.time.com/2013/12/16/the-triple-whopper-environmental-impact-of-global-meat-production/

attributes.action: Allow britain as a whole to vote for our capital londons mayor
attributes.background: We think as a nation who now is independent should have a say on who is made our capitals mayor the whole of britain should vote in for our capitals mayor
attributes.additional_details: Only london votes for the capitals mayor and we britain should have a say as it is our capital not just a city or town

attributes.action: Only Residents and Domiciles should be allowed to own British media companies
attributes.background: In the USA there is a law that restricts the ownership of media to US citizens. Now the UK is leaving the EU we are free to do the same. Only people with a vested interest in this countries best interests should be allowed to control such powerful tools of public opinion.
attributes.additional_details: All the major owners of the pro Brexit press are either non residents in the UK or claim non domicile tax status in order to mitigate their fair share of tax. It is time to put a stop to this in the same way as the EU was trying. Let's finish the job they started.

attributes.action: Relevant services must come together to prevent lives lost in open water yearly.
attributes.background: One 2011 July day my son Dylan went swimming at a local quarry; 20 minutes in he got into difficulty, unable to swim the short distance to safety. He reportedly died from cold water shock which has 4 stages; probably in the last stage when everything that has fought to stay alive relaxes.
attributes.additional_details: A minute earlier Dylan's rescuer could have saved his life. Currently the UK has nothing in place to prevent these needless deaths. Schools don't educate about the dangers in & around open water & there is no funding in place for prevention. Since Dylan died there has been another 2000 water related deaths. I want Dylan’s death to serve a purpose rather than for him to have died in vain. I want people to live because Dylan died.  We need change and we need it  now!

attributes.action: Recognise and accept the vital need to upgrade the A595. Take action and invest.
attributes.background: Cumbria has again experienced flooding and this has caused road closures - leaving residents stranded. This demonstrates once again the clear and urgent need for the A595 to be upgraded and ensure that it is fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone travelling from Millom and the south of the borough to West Cumbria face a 100 mile detour when the A595 is closed at Duddon. It is a ridiculous, inconvenient, and unnecessary situation that occurs far too regularly.

The inconvenience to residents and business is bad enough but we must also think of anyone unfortunate enough to have a medical emergency during these closures.

Action must be taken to ensure urgent upgrades that are required to this major arterial A road are completed.

attributes.action: EU nationals to apply for British Citizenship for free
attributes.background: Future Brexit negotiations, might restrict the rights of EU nationals to continue living and working in the UK. By allowing free citizenship applications UK Government can put this right, avoiding discrimination against those with low income. Applications should be accepted until 23 June 2022.
attributes.additional_details: By facilitating EU nationals to acquire British citizenship, UK Government has the opportunity to counteract the inability of EU nationals living and working in the UK to vote at the latest Referendum. Additionally, UK Government, by allowing free citizenship applications from EU nationals, will also send a strong message to those who wants to divide our society that UK is a truly tolerant country which values those who contribute to its prosperity.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to harass a learner driver who is on a lesson.
attributes.background: It is becoming more and more dangerous for driving instructors to teach learners on UK roads as we are continually harassed by other, so called "qualified" drivers. We are cut up, sworn at, threatened and verbally abused every day. This should be treated as a "hate crime".
attributes.additional_details: I have been overtaken on many occasions while approaching a pedestrian crossing or road junction in a dangerous manner. Sooner or late, (probably sooner), this will lead to a death or serious accident involving an innocent member of the public. There are many examples on various websites to support this.

attributes.action: Remove liquid security restrictions at UK airports for operating cabin crew.
attributes.background: Remove restrictions on cabin crew bringing liquids through airport security. The fact that cabin crew have access to a toxic fire extinguisher and an axe but we can't bring a yogurt or water to work seems completely ridiculous and potentially unsafe.

attributes.action: Have an official public inquiry into Deepcut Army Barracks
attributes.background:
Deepcut Army Barracks in Surrey has been the focus of the recent inquiry into how Private Cheryl James died at the barracks. 
Nobody will ever know the truth unfortunately but the hard fought battle of the James family has opened up some very searching questions into the home of the RLC
attributes.additional_details:
As a former soldier and trainee at Deepcut I wanted to start this online petition to get the government to start opening up about what went on at this place. I was recently involved in the BBC 2 documentary "The Army's shame" During my time there I was subjected to and seen physical brutality on a number of levels.
